title: Map & Locations
description: How well do you know the Fortnite island and its iconic locations?

questions.question: Which location was famous for having a giant tomato head?
questions.explanation: Tomato Town featured the iconic Uncle Pete's Pizza Pit with its giant tomato head mascot!

questions.question: Tilted Towers was one of the most popular landing spots in Chapter 1.
questions.explanation: Tilted Towers was legendary for its high-risk, high-reward gameplay and was often called the 'sweatiest' drop!

questions.question: What was the name of the snowy mountain area in Chapter 1?
questions.explanation: Polar Peak was added in Season 7 and contained a frozen castle with the Ice King inside!

questions.question: Which location featured a giant llama, crab, and fox in its early versions?

options.text: The map had all three as landmarks

questions.explanation: These were separate iconic landmarks scattered across the map - the giant pink llama near Junk Junction was especially popular!

questions.question: Loot Lake had a floating island at one point.
questions.explanation: During Season 6, the mysterious cube (Kevin) created a floating island above Loot Lake that moved around the map!

questions.question: What replaced Dusty Depot after the meteor strike?
questions.explanation: A meteor destroyed Dusty Depot in Season 4, creating Dusty Divot - a huge crater that eventually grew trees!

questions.question: Which named location was known for its clock tower?
questions.explanation: Tilted Towers had a famous clock tower that players loved to land on for an early-game advantage!

questions.question: The Fortnite island has a volcano that erupted during a live event.
questions.explanation: The volcano erupted at the end of Season 8, destroying Tilted Towers and Retail Row in the Unvaulting event!
